Posts.Content: On Nov 22, 2016 4:35 PM pamcam wrote: I am a five time cancer survivor.  I am 55 years old and all of my cancers happened between 50 and 55 years of age.  I am cancer free at this moment.  One of my cancers was breast cancer.  They put me on tamoxifen, which I was on for two years.  The side effects were horrible.  Memory loss, forgetfulness, extreme hot flashes and extreme anxiety to name a few.  I got my doctor to change me to arimidex which I was on for 16 months.  My side effects were extreme bone pain, tiredness, more memory loss, inability to put words together and extreme hot flashes.  I took myself off of it because this wasn't living.   I have been off the two drugs now for just over a year.  I still have bone aches and burning in my hips.  My shoulders are painful to the point that wearing a bra is very uncomfortable.  My ability to put words together is a constant battle.  My memory loss is frustrating.  My teeth are cracking and coming apart. The only thing that calmed down were my hot flashes.  All the aches and pains and even the teeth are doable.  What I am really scared about is that I have aquired dementia due to these pills.   I would love for someone to tell me their story and/or give me hope that I will live with this but it won't get worse.  I can do that.  Please share your story with me as right now it is not just me that notices these signs.  It is my husband, my friends and my employees. I was suicidal on the Tamoxifen.  I am currently 54.  So very similar in age.  I switched to Arimidex and had severe tremors to the point that I couldn't hold anything in my hands.  Quality of life, No.  Yes, everything you mentioned as well, memory loss, forgetfulness, hot flashes, joint pain.  I wish you the best.  I am on Lerisitole now.  Sometimes I take it, sometimes I don't.  I want to live.  Not have all of the shit side effects of the medicine.  Hugs  I am still getting nerve blocks.  My pain gets up to a level 5 frequently.  Doctor just tells me to go get another nerve block.  I was on gabapentin 1800 mg slept 18 hours a day.  Switched to Lyrica took a 3 hour nap the first day, plus came down with a bad rash.  No thanks.  Ugh
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: On Nov 25, 2016 9:16 PM Lisa88 wrote: Doctors always tell you not to go on-line about drugs.  Well, without the insight from "users" all of us would be duped into thining it was "in our heads".  I was diagnosed with breast cancer a little over a year ago. Had a lumpectomy and radiation.  If I knew then what I knew now I would have had a complete masectomy.   Went on arimidex for one year.  I was a 62 year old woman that was very active and able to work a second job.  That is done, although being physically active(walking, riding my bike, yoga,etc) does really help with the side effects.  My muscles and joints ached constantly, hot flashes , after I had been done with them, forgetting words, mood swings, etc.....  Went off for two months and things are improving. Now my oncologist wants me to go on Tamoxifen.  Haven't started taking them yet.  Just dont want to go through it right now.  Will decide in the next week.  The odds of it coming back are not significant enough for me to go back on.  Yet still a little scared.  This site has been extremely heapful for me.  Hope this is. why would you choose a lumpectomy over a mastecomy?  I had mutliple tumors, both sides, so bilateral mastecomy was the only option available.  I still have pain up to a 5 out of 10 and have been in remission for a year.  Why would you choose more pain?
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: I said that backwards.  Why would you wish for a mastecomy over a lumpectomy?  Pain is severe.  I am still getting nerve blocks.  Ribs, chest hurts all of the time.  Arm unable to move.  Did pt/ot for 2 years.  SEVERE pain.
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: Hugs to you as well.    I just wish I could find something to relieve my constant rib pain.   Feels like my ribs are broken all of the time.  Anytime I use my arm, ouch.
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: I was suicidal on Tamoxifen.    I also had a radical hysterectomy 2 months after starting Tamoxifen.   Tamoxifen is bad shit. Here is the deal.    If I would not have quit taking it I would be dead.   There is no doubt in my mind.   So, I quit taking it and I am alive.   That is the way I look at it.  The arimidex caused me severe tremors to the point that I couldn't hold anything in my hands.   I am currently on letrozole.   What does the Xgeva add?
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: I said that backwards.  Why would you wish for a mastecomy over a lumpectomy?  Pain is severe.  I am still getting nerve blocks.  Ribs, chest hurts all of the time.  Arm unable to move.  Did pt/ot for 2 years.  SEVERE pain.
